ExpoLog is an app for journaling your exposures that are done as part of cognitive behavioral therapy. Exposures are commonly used in the treatment of anxiety disorders like specific phobias, social anxiety disorder, and obsessive-compulsive disorder.\n\nThis app is not meant to provide professional guidance, and you are encouraged to consult with a trained mental health professional.

In Hierarchy, tap ADD to add a distressing activity to your fear and avoidance hierarchy. Your hierarchy will be sorted according to level of discomfort then avoidance, and a count of how many associated exposures will be shown.
 
From the Plans screen, tap PLAN to prepare for a new exposure. 
After completing an exposure, tap the planned exposure then fill in your reflections. 
Your logged exposures will be listed under Exposures.
